p: Assessing the KBAs composition, B. sacra exhibited a unique combination of low total content KBAs (1.0–2.8 µg/mg) and coincidently, a low proportion of α-KBA (1.1–6.6%) ( Figure 6a). Furthermore, B. sacra also showed a low proportion of α-AKBA (0.5–1.8%), but relatively high total contents of AKBAs with 21.7–41.8 µg/mg ( Figure 6b). This complies with previous studies that observed a high percentage of acetylated boswellic acids in B. sacra oleogum resins [ 5, 16].
